segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 46
segments.en: Linked Discourses 46

segments.pli: 6. Sākacchavagga
segments.en: 6. Discussion

segments.pli: 52. Pariyāyasutta
segments.en: 52. Is There a Way?

segments.pli: Atha kho sambahulā bhikkhū pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya sāvatthiṃ piṇḍāya pavisiṃsu.
segments.en: Then several mendicants robed up in the morning and, taking their bowls and robes, entered Sāvatthī for alms.

segments.pli: Atha kho tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ etadahosi:
segments.en: Then it occurred to him,

segments.pli: “atippago kho tāva sāvatthiyaṃ piṇḍāya carituṃ.
segments.en: “It’s too early to wander for alms in Sāvatthī.

segments.pli: Yannūna mayaṃ yena aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ ārāmo tenupasaṅkameyyāmā”ti.
segments.en: Why don’t we go to the monastery of the wanderers who follow other paths?”

segments.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū yena aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ ārāmo tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā tehi aññatitthiyehi paribbājakehi saddhiṃ sammodiṃsu.
segments.en: Then they went to the monastery of the wanderers who follow other paths, and exchanged greetings with the wanderers there.

segments.pli: Sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu. Ekamantaṃ nisinne kho te bhikkhū aññatitthiyā paribbājakā etadavocuṃ:
segments.en: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, they sat down to one side. The wanderers said to them:

segments.pli: “Samaṇo, āvuso, gotamo sāvakānaṃ evaṃ dhammaṃ deseti:
segments.en: “Reverends, the ascetic Gotama teaches his disciples like this:

segments.pli: ‘etha tumhe, bhikkhave, pañca nīvaraṇe pahāya cetaso upakkilese paññāya dubbalīkaraṇe satta bojjhaṅge yathābhūtaṃ bhāvethā’ti.
segments.en: ‘Mendicants, please give up the five hindrances—corruptions of the heart that weaken wisdom—and truly develop the seven awakening factors.’

segments.pli: Mayampi kho, āvuso, sāvakānaṃ evaṃ dhammaṃ desema:
segments.en: We too teach our disciples:

segments.pli: ‘etha tumhe, āvuso, pañca nīvaraṇe pahāya cetaso upakkilese paññāya dubbalīkaraṇe satta bojjhaṅge yathābhūtaṃ bhāvethā’ti.
segments.en: ‘Reverends, please give up the five hindrances—corruptions of the heart that weaken wisdom—and truly develop the seven awakening factors.’

segments.pli: Idha no, āvuso, ko viseso, ko adhippayāso, kiṃ nānākaraṇaṃ samaṇassa vā gotamassa amhākaṃ vā, yadidaṃ—dhammadesanāya vā dhammadesanaṃ, anusāsaniyā vā anusāsanin”ti?
segments.en: What, then, is the difference between the ascetic Gotama’s teaching and instruction and ours?”

segments.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū tesaṃ aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ bhāsitaṃ neva abhinandiṃsu nappaṭikkosiṃsu;
segments.en: Those mendicants neither approved nor dismissed that statement of the wanderers who follow other paths.

segments.pli: anabhinanditvā appaṭikkositvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkamiṃsu:
segments.en: They got up from their seat, thinking:

segments.pli: “bhagavato santike etassa bhāsitassa atthaṃ ājānissāmā”ti.
segments.en: “We will learn the meaning of this statement from the Buddha himself.”

segments.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū sāvatthiṃ piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkantā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu. Ekamantaṃ nisinnā kho te bhikkhū bhagavantaṃ etadavocuṃ:
segments.en: Then, after the meal, when they returned from alms-round, they went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and told him what had happened.

segments.pli: “Idha mayaṃ, bhante, pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya sāvatthiṃ piṇḍāya pavisimha.
Tesaṃ no, bhante, amhākaṃ etadahosi:
‘atippago kho tāva sāvatthiyaṃ piṇḍāya carituṃ,
yannūna mayaṃ yena aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ ārāmo tenupasaṅkameyyāmā’ti.
Atha kho mayaṃ, bhante, yena aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ ārāmo tenupasaṅkamimha; upasaṅkamitvā tehi aññatitthiyehi paribbājakehi saddhiṃ sammodimha.
Sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ nisīdimha. Ekamantaṃ nisinne kho amhe, bhante, aññatitthiyā paribbājakā etadavocuṃ:
‘Samaṇo, āvuso, gotamo sāvakānaṃ evaṃ dhammaṃ deseti “etha tumhe, bhikkhave, pañca nīvaraṇe pahāya cetaso upakkilese paññāya dubbalīkaraṇe satta bojjhaṅge yathābhūtaṃ bhāvethā”ti.
Mayampi kho, āvuso, sāvakānaṃ evaṃ dhammaṃ desema:
“etha tumhe, āvuso, pañca nīvaraṇe pahāya cetaso upakkilese paññāya dubbalīkaraṇe satta bojjhaṅge yathābhūtaṃ bhāvethā”ti.
Idha no, āvuso, ko viseso, ko adhippayāso, kiṃ nānākaraṇaṃ samaṇassa vā gotamassa amhākaṃ vā, yadidaṃ—dhammadesanāya vā dhammadesanaṃ, anusāsaniyā vā anusāsanin’ti?
Atha kho mayaṃ, bhante, tesaṃ aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ bhāsitaṃ neva abhinandimha nappaṭikkosimha, anabhinanditvā appaṭikkositvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkamimha:
‘bhagavato santike etassa bhāsitassa atthaṃ ājānissāmā’”ti.
“Evaṃvādino, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyā paribbājakā evamassu vacanīyā:
segments.en: “Mendicants, when wanderers who follow other paths say this, you should say to them:

segments.pli: ‘atthi panāvuso, pariyāyo, yaṃ pariyāyaṃ āgamma pañca nīvaraṇā dasa honti, satta bojjhaṅgā catuddasā’ti.
segments.en: ‘But reverends, is there a way in which the five hindrances become ten and the seven awakening factors become fourteen?’

segments.pli: Evaṃ puṭṭhā, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyā paribbājakā na ceva sampāyissanti, uttariñca vighātaṃ āpajjissanti.
segments.en: Questioned like this, the wanderers who follow other paths would be stumped, and, in addition, would get frustrated.

segments.pli: Taṃ kissa hetu?
segments.en: Why is that?

segments.pli: Yathā taṃ, bhikkhave, avisayasmiṃ.
segments.en: Because they’re out of their element.

segments.pli: Nāhaṃ taṃ, bhikkhave, passāmi sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya, yo imesaṃ pañhānaṃ veyyākaraṇena cittaṃ ārādheyya, aññatra tathāgatena vā tathāgatasāvakena vā ito vā pana sutvā.
segments.en: I don’t see anyone in this world—with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans—who could provide a satisfying answer to these questions except for the Realized One or his disciple or someone who has heard it from them.

segments.pli: Katamo ca, bhikkhave, pariyāyo, yaṃ pariyāyaṃ āgamma pañca nīvaraṇā dasa honti?
segments.en: And what is the way in which the five hindrances become ten?

segments.pli: Yadapi, bhikkhave, ajjhattaṃ kāmacchando tadapi nīvaraṇaṃ, yadapi bahiddhā kāmacchando tadapi nīvaraṇaṃ.
segments.en: Sensual desire for what is internal is a hindrance; and sensual desire for what is external is also a hindrance.

segments.pli: ‘Kāmacchandanīvaraṇan’ti iti hidaṃ uddesaṃ gacchati. Tadamināpetaṃ pariyāyena dvayaṃ hoti.
segments.en: That’s how what is concisely referred to as ‘the hindrance of sensual desire’ becomes twofold.

segments.pli: Yadapi, bhikkhave, ajjhattaṃ byāpādo tadapi nīvaraṇaṃ, yadapi bahiddhā byāpādo tadapi nīvaraṇaṃ.
segments.en: Ill will for what is internal is a hindrance; and ill will for what is external is also a hindrance.

segments.pli: ‘Byāpādanīvaraṇan’ti iti hidaṃ uddesaṃ gacchati. Tadamināpetaṃ pariyāyena dvayaṃ hoti.
segments.en: That’s how what is concisely referred to as ‘the hindrance of ill will’ becomes twofold.

segments.pli: Yadapi, bhikkhave, thinaṃ tadapi nīvaraṇaṃ, yadapi middhaṃ tadapi nīvaraṇaṃ.
segments.en: Dullness is a hindrance; and drowsiness is also a hindrance.

segments.pli: ‘Thinamiddhanīvaraṇan’ti iti hidaṃ uddesaṃ gacchati. Tadamināpetaṃ pariyāyena dvayaṃ hoti.
segments.en: That’s how what is concisely referred to as ‘the hindrance of dullness and drowsiness’ becomes twofold.

segments.pli: Yadapi, bhikkhave, uddhaccaṃ tadapi nīvaraṇaṃ, yadapi kukkuccaṃ tadapi nīvaraṇaṃ.
segments.en: Restlessness is a hindrance; and remorse is also a hindrance.

segments.pli: ‘Uddhaccakukkuccanīvaraṇan’ti iti hidaṃ uddesaṃ gacchati. Tadamināpetaṃ pariyāyena dvayaṃ hoti.
segments.en: That’s how what is concisely referred to as ‘the hindrance of restlessness and remorse’ becomes twofold.

segments.pli: Yadapi, bhikkhave, ajjhattaṃ dhammesu vicikicchā tadapi nīvaraṇaṃ, yadapi bahiddhā dhammesu vicikicchā tadapi nīvaraṇaṃ.
segments.en: Doubt about internal things is a hindrance; and doubt about external things is also a hindrance.

segments.pli: ‘Vicikicchānīvaraṇan’ti iti hidaṃ uddesaṃ gacchati. Tadamināpetaṃ pariyāyena dvayaṃ hoti.
segments.en: That’s how what is concisely referred to as ‘the hindrance of doubt’ becomes twofold.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ kho, bhikkhave, pariyāyo, yaṃ pariyāyaṃ āgamma pañca nīvaraṇā dasa honti.
segments.en: This is the way in which the five hindrances become ten.

segments.pli: Katamo ca, bhikkhave, pariyāyo, yaṃ pariyāyaṃ āgamma satta bojjhaṅgā catuddasa honti?
segments.en: And what is the way in which the seven awakening factors become fourteen?

segments.pli: Yadapi, bhikkhave, ajjhattaṃ dhammesu sati tadapi satisambojjhaṅgo, yadapi bahiddhā dhammesu sati tadapi satisambojjhaṅgo.
segments.en: Mindfulness of internal things is the awakening factor of mindfulness; and mindfulness of external things is also the awakening factor of mindfulness.

segments.pli: ‘Satisambojjhaṅgo’ti iti hidaṃ uddesaṃ gacchati. Tadamināpetaṃ pariyāyena dvayaṃ hoti.
segments.en: That’s how what is concisely referred to as ‘the awakening factor of mindfulness’ becomes twofold.

segments.pli: Yadapi, bhikkhave, ajjhattaṃ dhammesu paññāya pavicinati pavicarati parivīmaṃsamāpajjati tadapi dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgo, yadapi bahiddhā dhammesu paññāya pavicinati pavicarati parivīmaṃsamāpajjati tadapi dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgo.
segments.en: Investigating, exploring, and inquiring into internal things with wisdom is the awakening factor of investigation of principles; and investigating, exploring, and inquiring into external things with wisdom is also the awakening factor of investigation of principles.

segments.pli: ‘Dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgo’ti iti hidaṃ uddesaṃ gacchati. Tadamināpetaṃ pariyāyena dvayaṃ hoti.
segments.en: That’s how what is concisely referred to as ‘the awakening factor of investigation of principles’ becomes twofold.

segments.pli: Yadapi, bhikkhave, kāyikaṃ vīriyaṃ tadapi vīriyasambojjhaṅgo, yadapi cetasikaṃ vīriyaṃ tadapi vīriyasambojjhaṅgo.
segments.en: Physical energy is the awakening factor of energy; and mental energy is also the awakening factor of energy.

segments.pli: ‘Vīriyasambojjhaṅgo’ti iti hidaṃ uddesaṃ gacchati. Tadamināpetaṃ pariyāyena dvayaṃ hoti.
segments.en: That’s how what is concisely referred to as ‘the awakening factor of energy’ becomes twofold.

segments.pli: Yadapi, bhikkhave, savitakkasavicārā pīti tadapi pītisambojjhaṅgo, yadapi avitakkaavicārā pīti tadapi pītisambojjhaṅgo.
segments.en: Rapture while placing the mind and keeping it connected is the awakening factor of rapture; and rapture without placing the mind and keeping it connected is also the awakening factor of rapture.

segments.pli: ‘Pītisambojjhaṅgo’ti iti hidaṃ uddesaṃ gacchati. Tadamināpetaṃ pariyāyena dvayaṃ hoti.
segments.en: In this way what is concisely referred to as ‘the awakening factor of rapture’ becomes twofold.

segments.pli: Yadapi, bhikkhave, kāyappassaddhi tadapi passaddhisambojjhaṅgo, yadapi cittappassaddhi tadapi passaddhisambojjhaṅgo.
segments.en: Physical tranquility is the awakening factor of tranquility; and mental tranquility is also the awakening factor of tranquility.

segments.pli: ‘Passaddhisambojjhaṅgo’ti iti hidaṃ uddesaṃ gacchati. Tadamināpetaṃ pariyāyena dvayaṃ hoti.
segments.en: In this way what is concisely referred to as ‘the awakening factor of tranquility’ becomes twofold.

segments.pli: Yadapi, bhikkhave, savitakko savicāro samādhi tadapi samādhisambojjhaṅgo, yadapi avitakkaavicāro samādhi tadapi samādhisambojjhaṅgo.
segments.en: Immersion while placing the mind and keeping it connected is the awakening factor of immersion; and immersion without placing the mind and keeping it connected is also the awakening factor of immersion.

segments.pli: ‘Samādhisambojjhaṅgo’ti iti hidaṃ uddesaṃ gacchati. Tadamināpetaṃ pariyāyena dvayaṃ hoti.
segments.en: In this way what is concisely referred to as ‘the awakening factor of immersion’ becomes twofold.

segments.pli: Yadapi, bhikkhave, ajjhattaṃ dhammesu upekkhā tadapi upekkhāsambojjhaṅgo, yadapi bahiddhā dhammesu upekkhā tadapi upekkhāsambojjhaṅgo.
segments.en: Equanimity for internal things is the awakening factor of equanimity; and equanimity for external things is also the awakening factor of equanimity.

segments.pli: ‘Upekkhāsambojjhaṅgo’ti iti hidaṃ uddesaṃ gacchati. Tadamināpetaṃ pariyāyena dvayaṃ hoti.
segments.en: In this way what is concisely referred to as ‘the awakening factor of equanimity’ becomes twofold.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ kho, bhikkhave, pariyāyo, yaṃ pariyāyaṃ āgamma satta bojjhaṅgā catuddasā”ti.
segments.en: This is the way in which the seven awakening factors become fourteen.”

segments.pli: Dutiyaṃ.

sections.title: Then several mendicants robed up in the morning and,…

suttaplex.blurb: Some wanderers tell some Buddhist mendicants that they, too, teach the five hindrances and the seven awakening factors, so what is the difference? The Buddha explains by giving a detailed analytical treatment that he says is beyond the scope of the wanderers.
